questions.question_text: Which of the below mentioned conditions form a neighbor relationship in EIGRP? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
B is correct:
Router(config)# ipv6 router rip cisco
Router(config-rtr)# split-horizon

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/ipv6/command/ipv6-cr-book/ipv6-s6.html

questions.question_text: A network engineer is disabling split horizon on a point-to-multipoint interface that is running RIPng. Under which configuration mode can split horizon be disabled?

choices.A: Route targets uniquely identify the customer routing table
choices.C: Route targets are supported only when BGP is configured
choices.E: When BGP is configured, route targets are transmitted as BGP standard communities
choices.F: Route targets allos customers to be assigned overlapping adresses
choices.B: Route targets control the import and export of routes into a customer routing table
choices.D: When IS-IS is configured, route targets identify the circuit level in which the customer resides

questions.question_text: Which two statements about route targets that are configured with VRF-Lite are true? (Choose two.)

Redistributing BGP into OSPF what statement is correct?
route-map deny 10
match ip address 10
route-map permit 20
access-list 10 permit 172.16.0.0 0.0.0.255

choices.D: All routes will be filtered. A
choices.A: 172.16.0.0/24 will NOT be redistributed into OSPF.
choices.C: Routes permitted by ACL 10 will be redistributed.

discussion.content: A. 172.16.0.0/24 will NOT be redistributed into OSPF.

choices.B: Distributing E1 and E2 using prefix list
choices.C: Distributing E1 and E2 using access list

discussion.content: the only important part of the answer is prefix list, used for route filtering

questions.answer_description: Access list is for traffic filtering & prefix list is for route filtering
questions.question_text: A route map was configured and it was distributing OSPF external routes __________.
